RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUPER KHOZAN chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn then angled to the five path leaving the turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement and got up the final strides. BARB'S PRIDE chased through the backstretch and dueled to a slim lead three wide leaving the turn, dueled clear mid-stretch but was caught in the final strides. BABY BULLDOG pressured the pace inside and raced at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the turn, then flattened the final sixteenth. ITCHY PALMS chased outside, rounded the turn in the seven path, left the turn widest and closed well through the lane. TACOMA AUSTIN hesitated at the break and raced well back from early contention, rounded the turn off the rail, eased outward into the lane and improved his position. BUY HERE PAY HERE was hustled to the front approaching the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge two deep on the turn, gave up the nod into the lane and flattened stride. MIMS SECOND CHANCE engaged in close early chase but faded at the rail on the turn. BAL ROBINSON gave close early chase then faded in the four path of the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Bulldog
ENTRY.OWNER: Rose David J and Khalaf Wadie F

ENTRY.NAME: Barb's Pride
ENTRY.OWNER: P and H Stables and C and B Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Tacoma Austin
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated break,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,improved position

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Four Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVINE FASHION settled off the early pace in the three path, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole and took the lead three wide toward the head of the lane, dueled clear inside the eighth pole and was steadily handled to the finish. TEMPORARILY raced off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced close four wide on the far turn and dueled clear for second mid-stretch. SHINY PENNY moved to the inside and rated a slim early lead, was met at the nine sixteenths, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths and raced close two deep on the far turn, but flattened inside the eighth pole. LIGHTFOOT MISS raced well back in the three path the first turn, bid from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path and passed rivals outside. SOCIAL EXCLUSION saved early ground, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. CHIT CHAT GIRL showed little response. MAGIC IN ME stalked from the three path early then took the lead three wide at the nine sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure at the five sixteenths, was caught at the rail approaching the head of the lane and weakened. HUFFLEPUFF raced with the early pace two deep, gave chase into the backstretch but faded at the rail approaching the five sixteenths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Lightfoot Miss
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back 3p,bid 3/8,5p far turn,passed rivals outside

ENTRY.NAME: Hufflepuff
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JULY 14, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOADED SNIPER took a quick lead and set a pressured pace while tapering inward, raced at the rail on the turn and held on well under steady stretch handling. FREEDOM IS RINGING chased toward mid track through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four path and closed for second later yards. NOT A TRICK pressured the pace, rounded the turn in the three path then dueled for third while outfinished for second. SHACKLEFORDS STORM pressed the pace from the inside, rounded the turn off the rail then outfinished in the stretch duel for third. JAMMIN STILL chased, rounded the turn in the four path and finished evenly to pass rivals. WIDGET FACTORY raced well back outside, rounded the turn in the five path and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. CASH FOR THE SOUL gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn then weakened. ALPHA QUEUE gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Not a Trick
ENTRY.OWNER: Dunham Thoroughbreds and KCMH Racing LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Freedom Is Ringing
ENTRY.OWNER: Walker Devin D and Parrish Wallace
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased mid track,4p turn,closed 2nd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Loaded Sniper
ENTRY.OWNER: P and H Stables and C and B Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Alpha Queue
ENTRY.OWNER: T D C B E Stable and Huber John

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since N ovember 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BO'S BOURBON took over at the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was hand urged away from the five sixteenths pole, widened at the rail on the far turn then kept alert in the lane. ISLAND D'LITE tapered in and stalked the early pace two deep, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn but drifted out leaving the turn, lugged in from the eighth pole and flattened stride. TREJO rated close inside, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and showed little in the lane. SLIPPERY WHEN WET was shuffled back at the start and rounded the opening turn in the four path, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little more. HAGGERSDALE rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole then faded in the three path of the far turn. GABRIEL'S WING raced in the five path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. REVERE NOTE raced off the rail on the first turn and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Trejo
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 1/2,3p far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Bo's Bourbon
ENTRY.OWNER: Metz Larry and Bone Robert D
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,hand urged 5/16,rail far turn,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Slippery When Wet
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back start,4p 1st turn,eased out 1/2,chased,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 21800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Wei ght Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIME AFTER LIME chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the six path and left the turn outside, took the lead a sixteenth away and drew off later yards. THELADYISTRUE gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn then closed to take second later yards. WITNESS THE ENERGY dueled for the early lead and set a pressured pace, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn but was caught flattening stride mid-stretch. CASTLE LIGHTS raced with the early pace then gave chase from the three eighths pole, dueled close three wide on the turn but flattened mid-stretch. MY PRETTY EYES chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail, eased outward mid-stretch and finished evenly. IRON LADY AWAY contested the early pace and raced close off the rail on the turn, then weakened. JUBA'S HOUSE was not a factor and rounded the turn about the four path. ALL WORKED UP gave chase then flattened on the turn.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCYLOU WHO took the lead nearing the three quarter pole, moved to the inside midway on the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was steadily handled to late yards before being taken in hand. ELLIES LIL CASTLE saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, eased outward into the lane and came along for second later yards. BOUNDTOBEOK settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole but dropped back through the far turn and flattened in the lane. DALLAS raced well back saving ground, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn but showed little more. KATALIMA raced well off the pace and off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and showed little in the lane. WHALE OF A TIME raced in the three and four paths the first turn then faded past the three eighths pole. LADY CINCO DE MAYO rated close off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. Per Stewards Ruling #25, Lucylou Who has been disqualified from earnings.

ENTRY.NAME: Dallas
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Boundtobeok
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 3/8,dropped back far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Cinco de Mayo
ENTRY.COMMENT: close off rail,chased 7/16,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Lucylou Who
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/4,pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,in hand late

ENTRY.NAME: Ellies Lil Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,along 2nd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15, 000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SAYYESTOTHELADY chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then dug in to take the nod in the final yards. JACKS SISTER JILL set a pressured pace while tapering in through the backstretch, contested the rail on the turn but gave up the nod in a late duel. TIMETOGETUP chased inside, came out and made contact with Cedar's Wish in the vicinity of the five sixteenths pole, eased outward toward the head of the lane and dug in to take third at the wire. SLEWING chased and rounded the turn off the rail, finished well but was nipped from third under the wire. WINDSOR'S PLAY chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened from mid-stretch. EMBERLY chased toward the outside, rounded the turn in the four path then flattened. CEDAR'S WISH became a bit fractious in the gate then gave chase toward mid track, was brushed in the vicinity of the five sixteenths pole, ran in the six path of the turn then weakened in the lane. LEMONSONDESURPRISE was through early and rounded the turn near the rail. CHURCH KEY gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the five path and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Sayyestothelady
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,dug in lane,nod final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Jacks Sister Jill
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,yield nod late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AT THE GATE checked off the heels of Right To Assemble early on then settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, took the lead three wide approaching the head of the lane, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on well. SERIOUS MOMENT settled back in the three path the opening turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and dug in to take second in the final strides. MOHAYMEN DAY settled off the rail on the first turn then stalked three wide into the backstretch, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, entered the far turn about the three path and took a brief slim lead midway through the turn, but was met into the lane then nipped from second the final strides. I'M SO EXTRA tapered in and took over toward the three quarter pole then rated the pace, dug in to the challenge of Right To Assemble leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was caught at the rail midway on the far turn then weakened. REGGAETONI angled out on the first turn and entered the backstretch outside, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. RIGHT TO ASSEMBLE angled in and stalked leaving the three quarter pole, moved to even terms into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenths, but faded past the five sixteenths. JASIRA saved ground on the first turn and was never a factor. HERECOMESPUDD dropped well back early on and never factored.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Country Life Farm & Miss Moonshine LLC
